title: 820-3476 PPbuS_G3H, S5_PWRGD, Fan Spin present
message:
THis board has S5 Power rails and fan spin.

No PP5v5S4 or PP3v3_S4

PM_SLP_S4_L is 0V
3V3_S5 =3.3V
SMC Adapter EN= 3.4V
PM_BATLOW _L= 0V
PM_DSW_PWRGD,= 3.4v
PCH_DSWVRMEN,= 3.24V
PM_RSMRST_L, = 3.3V
PM_PWRBTN_L = 3.4V

title: 820-3476 PPbuS_G3H, S5_PWRGD, Fan Spin present
message: Really strange, the fan is powered from 5V_S0, derived from 5V_S4...

title: 820-3476 PPbuS_G3H, S5_PWRGD, Fan Spin present
message: Dah.. my bad there is NO fan spin. Working on too many projects w/o enough sleep I guess.

title: 820-3476 PPbuS_G3H, S5_PWRGD, Fan Spin present
message:
"PM_BATLOW _L= 0V"
Original 60/85W Magsafe 2 charger?
Check if board starts with both charger and battery connected.

title: 820-3476 PPbuS_G3H, S5_PWRGD, Fan Spin present
message: NO boot original 85w magsafe 2 and battery.

title: 820-3476 PPbuS_G3H, S5_PWRGD, Fan Spin present
message:
Do not confuse between boot and start.
A board can start (turns on), but doesn't boot (not working really).

You don't get any pulse on big coils?
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L.

PM_SLP_SUS_L and 3V3_SUS present?
Check all RTC signals.

title: 820-3476 PPbuS_G3H, S5_PWRGD, Fan Spin present
message:
No on the pulsing big coils.
no drop pulse on pm_pwrbtn_L when triggering smc_ONOFF_L
PM_SLP_SUS_L= 3.3V
3v3_SUS = 3.3V
all RTC signals over 3V

title: 820-3476 PPbuS_G3H, S5_PWRGD, Fan Spin present
message:
"no drop pulse on pm_pwrbtn_L when triggering smc_ONOFF_L"
This points to SMC issue.
But keep in mind, PCH can still block the SMC to make its job correctly.

Changing SMC is the next step.
However, check first signals and voltages for U5000 (2 OF 2) at page 36.
Just in case, try to start in SMC bypass also.

title: 820-3476 PPbuS_G3H, S5_PWRGD, Fan Spin present
message: This board magically started up while I was poking around and now consistently starts. I reflowed the SMC regardless and gave it a love tap. No boot. I couldn't get my EZP2019 to flash a new bios to the chip so I swapped bios from different board and it now boots but running high fans so guessing may need cleanME which I'm not sure I'm going to be able to do. The chip appears to be a Micron 25Q064 which isn't an option and none of the "close" options are working either.

title: 820-3476 PPbuS_G3H, S5_PWRGD, Fan Spin present
message: Did you try to solder back original BIOS chip and test again?

title: 820-3476 PPbuS_G3H, S5_PWRGD, Fan Spin present
message:
Replacing the battery seemed to calm everything down. Tested over and over and it seems to be holding up. guessing heating board up and reflowing the SMC brought it back to life and the battery needed to be replaced for it to be back in full working order.

Thanks again!
